title: Strings
description: Using String and &str types in Rust.

codeExamples.title: Basic String
codeExamples.explanation: String::new() creates an empty string. push_str() adds a string, push() adds a character. String::from() creates a string from a literal.

codeExamples.title: String Concatenation
codeExamples.explanation: The + operator moves the first string and takes the second as a reference. The format! macro doesn't move, both strings remain usable.

codeExamples.title: String Iteration
codeExamples.explanation: The chars() method returns characters (grapheme clusters), the bytes() method returns bytes. For UTF-8 strings, one character can be multiple bytes.

exercises.title: String Operations
exercises.description: Create a String, add texts to it, and print it!
